attributes.action: Breach of Code of Conduct - Prime Minister and his Business Secretary
attributes.additional_details:
There is overwhelming evidence that the Prime Minister and his Business Secretary are in breach of their Minsisterial Code of Conduct. This relates to alleged offences within the Registrar of Companies to which the two Government Ministers support.

Those offences include:
- Being less than honest when being investigated by the Parliamentary Ombudsman
- Misleading the General Public regarding FOI (Freedom of Information) requests
- Blocking references on two occasions to the Independent Adjudicator as per written complaints procedures //www.companieshouse.gov.uk/about/tellUs_complaints.shtml.

The Petitoner requests that the matter be thoroughly investigated by a Senior Member of the Cabinet Office,
